data.text: @catticusrex49 I would follow the instructions, donâ€™t trust the result after the time stated in the booklet. But you should still isolate if you live with someone who tested positive
@catticusrex49 The line isn't reliable after a certain time. Check the booklet in your box of tests and it should tell you if it's worth paying attention to x

@catticusrex49 I have heard that the result is not reliable after the time because the chemicals degrade. I found one article by Metro UK supporting what I heard, but have not yet found the right keywords for studies on that subject. 

https://t.co/ILM3YOKCyX
To be clear I've been isolating since Tuesday save for a couple of essential trips to buy food (we aren't able to stock up for weeks at a time in our little flat). This is just so confusing! 3/3

So I did a second test to check since I didn't see how the first one looked at 30mins (the booklet says don't read the result after 30mins). As you can see in the photo, the test on the right is definitely negative at 30mins.

Does anyone know what this means? 2/
